item.title: U.S. 10-Year Treasury Yield May Fall Further, Charts Show
item.description: The U.S. 10-year Treasury yield may fall further, based on technical charts, UOB’s Global Economics & Markets Research said.

item.title: Roche to Buy Carmot Therapeutics for $2.7 Billion
item.description: Roche said it would buy the California-based obesity and diabetes drugs maker for $2.7 billion with additional payments of up to $400 million based on development milestones.

item.title: Spotify to Lay Off 17% of Staff, Its Third Round of Job Cuts This Year
item.description: The streaming giant will cut about 1,500 more jobs as it accelerates a profitability push.

item.title: Under voucher plans that pay for private schooling with public funds, students who have already opted out of public schools are among the biggest beneficiaries, state data indicate.
item.description: Under voucher plans that pay for private schooling with public funds, students who have already opted out of public schools are among the biggest beneficiaries, state data indicate.

item.title: A U.S. destroyer and three commercial ships in the Red Sea came under drone and missile attacks, a significant escalation of recent strikes on vessels in those waters.
item.description: A U.S. destroyer and three commercial ships in the Red Sea came under drone and missile attacks, a significant escalation of recent strikes on vessels in those waters.

item.title: Nicaragua charged a Miss Universe franchise owner with being part of a plot to overthrow Ortega two weeks after the country won the pageant.
item.description: Nicaragua charged a Miss Universe franchise owner with being part of a plot to overthrow Ortega two weeks after the country won the pageant.

item.title: Talks between Israel and Hamas to hand over hostages held in Gaza in return for a truce stalled, while Israeli forces escalated attacks and directed Palestinians in the enclave to move to a narrower strip of land.
item.description: Talks between Israel and Hamas to hand over hostages held in Gaza in return for a truce stalled, while Israeli forces escalated attacks and directed Palestinians in the enclave to move to a narrower strip of land.

item.title: Global leaders at the COP28 climate summit in Dubai are taking a big swing at cutting methane, while the U.S. set rules on domestic fuel producers to limit emissions of the gas.
item.description: Global leaders at the COP28 climate summit in Dubai are taking a big swing at cutting methane, while the U.S. set rules on domestic fuel producers to limit emissions of the gas.

item.title: A lawsuit to be heard by the Supreme Court takes aim at a 2017 law imposing a tax on companies' overseas profits, and could have wider implications over Congress's taxing power.
item.description: A lawsuit to be heard by the Supreme Court takes aim at a 2017 law imposing a tax on companies’ overseas profits, and could have wider implications over Congress’s taxing power.

item.title: Germany Books Wider Trade Surplus as Exports Fall Again
item.description: The eurozone’s most important economy booked a bigger-than forecast-trade surplus of almost €18 billion, as exports of German goods fell for a fourth straight month.

item.title: The New Green Investment: Getting Clean Energy to Big Cities
item.description: EnergyRe, a startup backed by real-estate executives, raises $1.2 billion for transmission lines to carry renewable electricity to urban areas.

item.title: Gold's Uptrend Intact, But Minor Pullback Likely, Charts Show
item.description: Gold’s medium-term uptrend is intact, but a minor pullback is possible, based on technical analysis, Oanda said.

item.title: Brookfield-Led Consortium's $11 Billion Bid for Origin Energy Fails
item.description: An $11 billion bid for Origin Energy, one of Australia’s largest power companies, was rejected by its shareholders on Monday in a stark illustration of how investors are adopting different strategies to bet on the energy transition.

item.title: Toyota to Offer Around 15 Zero-Emission Vehicles in Europe by 2026
item.description: Toyota Motor plans to offer around 15 different zero-emission vehicles, ranging from passenger cars to light commercial vehicles, in Europe by 2026.

item.title: Nikkei Ends 0.6% Lower on a Stronger JPY
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average fell 0.6% to close at 33231.27, dragged down by JPY strength, which hurts the overseas earnings of exporters when repatriated to Japan.

item.title: USD/SGD Edges Higher Amid Rising Treasury Yields
item.description: USD/SGD edged higher in the Asian afternoon session amid rising Treasury yields, which increase the appeal of U.S. fixed-income assets and demand for USD.

item.title: Evergrande Shares Rise as Court Grants More Time for Debt Talks
item.description: China Evergrande’s shares rose after a court granted the Chinese property developer more time to work out a plan to restructure billions of dollars in debt.

item.title: An Islamist radical stabbed a foreign tourist to death near the Eiffel Tower in Paris, French authorities said, rattling a country already on alert.
item.description: An Islamist radical stabbed a foreign tourist to death near the Eiffel Tower in Paris, French authorities said, rattling a country already on alert.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Inside Anduril, the Defense Startup That's Run Like a Tech Company
item.description: Startup Anduril Industries is shaking up the U.S. defense industry. Founded by Oculus creator Palmer Luckey, Anduril is building AI-powered, autonomous weapons systems that it says will create a more nimble and cost-effective military.
